text: Taxiles ( lived 4th century BC) was the Greek chroniclers' name for the ruler who ruled over the comple between the Indus and the Jhelum (Hydaspes) Rivers in the Punjab region at the time of Alexander the Great's expedition. His real name was Ambhi (Greek: Omphis).Diodorus Siculus, Bibliotheca, xvii. 86Curtius Rufus, Historiae Alexandri Magni, viii. 12 ==References== Category:4th-century BC births Category:Gandhara
title: Taxiles
